raft.jpct.bones
Class SkeletonDebugger

java.lang.Object
  raft.jpct.bones.SkeletonDebugger

public class SkeletonDebugger
extends Object

Helper class to visually represent a SkeletonPose.

This class is adapted from Ardor3D.

Field Detail

minBoneLength

public static float minBoneLength
Minimum length of a bone. Sometimes joints may overlap, resulting bones will not have a length of zero but this value.

DEFAULT_BONE_SCALE

public static final float DEFAULT_BONE_SCALE
Default value of bone scale.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_JOINT_SCALE

public static final float DEFAULT_JOINT_SCALE
Default value of joint scale.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SkeletonDebugger

public SkeletonDebugger(SkeletonPose pose,
                        int... ignoreJoints)
Creates a new Debugger with DEFAULT_BONE_SCALE and DEFAULT_JOINT_SCALE

Parameters:
pose - the pose this debugger represents
ignoreJoints - these joints and the bones associated with them will not be displayed.

SkeletonDebugger

public SkeletonDebugger(SkeletonPose pose,
                        float boneScale,
                        float jointScale,
                        int... ignoreJoints)
Creates a new Debugger with given scale.

Parameters:
pose - the pose this debugger represents
boneScale - scale of bone
ignoreJoints - these joints and the bones associated with them will not be displayed.
See Also:
Primitives.getPyramide(float, float)
Method Detail

getBoneObjects

public List<Object3D> getBoneObjects()
Returns the Object3Ds which represent bones. Some of them may be null.

getJointObjects

public List<Object3D> getJointObjects()
Returns the Object3Ds which represent joints. Bones are virtual links between a joint and its parent (if any) Some of them may be null.

update

public void update(SkeletonPose pose)
Updates bone and joint objects according to given pose.

addToWorld

public void addToWorld(World world)
Adds all joint and bone objects to given world.

setVisibility

public void setVisibility(boolean visible)
Sets visibility of joint and bone objects.
